oai_dc:dc.dc:title: RULE-BASED CONTROLLER FOR AN HVDC TRANSMISSION-SYSTEM
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PAREKH, BR
BANERJEE, SK
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: rule based controller
transmission systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rule based techniques for controlling processes have existed for over a decade, incorporating expert systems in their design. This paper outlines the theory behind a simple rule based controller (RBC) and its application to an HVDC system as a current (pole) controller. HVDC systems having different configurations, namely, a two-terminal HVDC system and a three-terminal star-connected HVDC system, were simulated to study the performance of the RBC, using Manitoba HVDC Research Centre's EMTDC package. This paper also compares the results obtained using the RBC with those obtained with a conventional current controller.
